data.description_md:
[![ahc76-xxx-badass-Kohaku-doing-magicks-cloud.png](https://i.postimg.cc/RFRpb8J0/ahc76-xxx-badass-Kohaku-doing-magicks-cloud.png)](https://postimg.cc/0MzCzVfg) _Credit: Aleksander Karcz and Pixoloid Studios_ # **[Kōhaku Narukami](/card/10012) is both a Blessing for your Team and a Curse for the Ancient Ones, by manipulating Blurse to his advantage without any impact on his group.** >With full Blurse access, this Deck Guide explores all the different builds for Kōhaku: >1. Flex with Full or Revised-only collection 2. Cluever with Full or Revised-only collection 3. Fighter with Full or Revised-only collection 4. True Solo with Full or Revised-only collection 5. Flex, Cluever or Fighter in a Bless-heavy team 6. Core + Feast of Hemlock Vale Investigator Expansion only! >Check the "Make Your Own Deck!" section for all the links. `Please don't forget to press the ♥ if you like the Deck and the work that has been put into making it :)` ___
**
Introduction
** > **This deck is designed to be played in any group, even if no one wants to use Blurse tech.** I rarely played Blurse decks because the prospect of forcing others to adapt their deck to mine is off-putting. Most of us who own The Innsmouth Conspiracy did one Blurse run at some point, but after that, the only interaction we have with Blurse is because of [Faustian Bargain](/card/07028) or [Accursed Follower](/card/07038). And this expansion is a good illustration of this. Sure, all the other investigators have a bit of blurse tech they could use, but I would much rather play my [Kōhaku Narukami](/card/10012) deck next to an [Alessandra Zorzi](/card/10009) deck, or anyone else, and be able to tell my friend: _Don't worry, you won't notice it._ And so that's the guiding principle of this deck: > **Make sure that you won't leave tokens in the bag for your teammates.** Because even 3 and 3 can lead to annoying situations during the Mythos Phase. Finally, don't be put off by the difficulty of this deck, especially when playing it during a campaign, as the complexity increases along with your experience playing it, and learning how to master _The Folklorist_ is extremely satisfying. ___ As the new expansion comes out, it is time for some blind runs! I have been publishing deck guides for each investigator from the last 2 expansions, so this year, I decided to make it a little bit different. I asked other content creators to join in for the fun! [![ahc76-preview-590x250.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/zX6B8cs2/ahc76-preview-590x250.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/F7bmxDs0) Here are the decks and resources related to each investigator: * ** Wilson Richards ** * [DerBK](https://arkhamdb.com/user/profile/32108/DerBK) from the [Ancient Evils Blog](https://derbk.com/ancientevils/) * [The Article about this Wilson Deck](https://derbk.com/ancientevils/tools-gold-a-wilson-richards-primer/) * [The ArkhamDB Deck Guide](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/47005/tool-guys-don-t-look-at-explosions-fhv-intro-deck-guide-1.0) * ** Kate Winthrop ** * [ElseWhere](https://arkhamdb.com/user/profile/25253/ElseWhere) from the [Strength in Numbers Blog](https://strengthinnumbersarkham.wordpress.com/) * [The article about this Kate Deck](https://strengthinnumbersarkham.wordpress.com/2024/02/20/an-introduction-to-kate-winthrop/) * [The ArkhamDB Deck Guide](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/47002/kate-doesn-t-need-roads-fhv-intro-deck-guide-1.0) * **Alessandra Zorzi ** * [dscarpac](https://arkhamdb.com/user/profile/38596/dscarpac) from the [Quick Learner Youtube channel](https://www.youtube.com/@Quick_Learner) * [The Youtube video presenting the Deck](https://youtu.be/sDVzZ_TZ-i4) * [The ArkhamDB Deck](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/47003/alessandra-s-parley-party-fhv-intro-deck-guide-1.0) * ** Kōhaku Narukami ** * [Valentin1331](https://arkhamdb.com/user/profile/42890/Valentin1331) * [The ArkhamDB Deck Guide](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/47001) * ** Hank Samson** * Justin from PlayingBoardGames [[Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/@PlayingBoardGames) & [Twitch](https://www.twitch.tv/playingboardgames)] * [The Youtube video presenting the Deck](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Tfkskzdg03Q) * [The ArkhamDB Deck](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/47006/tank-samson-fhv-intro-deck-guide-1.0) ___

Main Strategy:
** * Add tokens: * with [Kōhaku](/card/10012)'s ability. * with [Gabriel Carillo](/card/10052), [Prismatic Spectacles](/card/10056), or [Kōhaku](/card/10012)'s ability. * Turn these tokens into benefits: * means +2 skill value and no token pull once per turn thanks to the [Ancient Covenant](/card/07122). * means: * Infinite charges or +1 damage with [Armageddon](/card/07117). * 2 clues with [Prismatic Spectacles](/card/10056). * 2 resources with [The Key of Solomon](/card/10104). * Infinite recursion of [Read the Signs (2)](/card/10101) / [Spectral Razor (2)](/card/10102). * 2 testless damage with the [Servant of Brass](/card/10107) summoned by [Seal of the Elders](/card/10105). * Negate the modifier of tokens by committing 2 [Fey](/card/07222). * Store additional on [Favor of the Moon](/card/07271) for more benefits. * Make sure that you only add as many as you can use in your turn. ___
**
Blurse Management :
** [![ahc76-aetheric-current-preview-590x250.png](https://i.postimg.cc/MpFfSXLf/ahc76-aetheric-current-preview-590x250.png)](https://postimg.cc/mP7g3ZBT) ** Adding Tokens: ** * If you know that you will need more Tokens than what your Assets/Promise of Power can generate, you can use [Kōhaku Narukami](/card/10012)'s ability for a . * [Gabriel Carillo](/card/10052) adds a for a card. Note that this is _optional_ and doesn't require [Gabriel](/card/10052) to exhaust. * The [Prismatic Spectacles](/card/10056) also add a when using them to investigate. Note that they only exhaust to get an additional clue. * [Promise of Power](/card/07032) can generate a in a pinch. * [Deep Knowledge](/card/07023) and [Faustian Bargain](/card/07028) add 2 tokens each. ** Using your Tokens: ** * [Book of Living Myths](/card/10013) can be used once a turn to pull a token: * During an [Armageddon](/card/07117) test to either get your charge back (practically making [Armageddon](/card/07117) endless) or deal 3 damage in one attack. * During a [Prismatic Spectacles](/card/10056) test to get 2 clues. * During [Read the Signs (2)](/card/10101) or [Spectral Razor (2)](/card/10102) so you get it back to your hand at the end of your turn. * On any other test in which you committed 2 [Fey](/card/07222) for a total of +2 , +4 skill value to this test. * If you need more than one per turn, you have [Favor of the Moon](/card/07271). * This is really good to use [Prismatic Spectacles](/card/10056) to get 2 clues, and [Read the Signs (2)](/card/10101) the same turn, or attack twice this turn with [Armageddon](/card/07117). * Using [Book of Living Myths](/card/10013) and [Favor of the Moon](/card/07271) on the same test once is enough to trigger the [Seal of the Elders](/card/10105) and summon a [Servant of Brass](/card/10107). From now on, a single [Armageddon](/card/07117) + attack is worth 5 damage! * Don't forget to gain 1 resource when using a from the [Favor of the Moon](/card/07271). * [The Key of Solomon](/card/10104) is the last big consumer. * Gaining 2 resources per turn pays for your setup and, even more importantly, your incessant use of [Read the Signs (2)](/card/10101) and [Spectral Razor (2)](/card/10102) ___ ** Adding Tokens: ** * There is only one way in this deck to add tokens: [Kōhaku](/card/10012)'s ability. * Because [Gabriel Carillo](/card/10052) has the same window as [Kōhaku](/card/10012) you can chose which one to trigger first. If your bag has 1 / 0 , you can first activate [Gabriel](/card/10052) to reach 1/1 and then [Kōhaku](/card/10012)'s ability to add a 2nd token. ** Using Tokens: ** * These tokens are then easy to pull with the [Book of Living Myths](/card/10013), (as long as there is 1 more or a tie). This triggers the [Ancient Covenant](/card/07122) for a secured success since no other token is revealed. * Starting a turn with a token can be helpful in case you draw treachery that justifies using your [Book of Living Myths](/card/10013) during the Mythos phase, like a [Grasping Hands](/card/01162) for instance. * Because [Read the Signs (2)](/card/10101) and [Spectral Razor (2)](/card/10102) come back to your hand with any symbol, it is preferable to use a + [Ancient Covenant](/card/07122) when playing them to avoid the . * If you have enough resources, or you are low in health/sanity, you can use [The Key of Solomon](/card/10104) to heal anyone at your location, , significantly decreasing the chances of anyone in your party being defeated. Don't forget that [Kōhaku Narukami](/card/10012)'s ability is optional, so you are not forced to use it. But overall, leaving tokens in the bag will most likely be appreciated unless your partner is [Stella Clark](/card/60501). ___
**
Turn and Sequence examples:
** Every turn will start by assessing your board state and what you need to do this round. 1. Decide if you need to investigate, fight or anything else, and check the bag situation. 2. Check how many generators you want to use: [Gabriel Carillo](/card/10052) if you need to draw, and [Prismatic Spectacles](/card/10056) if you need to investigate, or events like [Deep Knowledge](/card/07023). 3. Check how many consumers you have: [Book of Living Myths](/card/10013), [The Key of Solomon](/card/10104), [Favor of the Moon](/card/07271) in hand. 4. Decide if you want to add a or a with [Kōhaku](/card/10012)'s ability and start your turn. `Pro tip: ` * It helps to pair cards: [Gabriel](/card/10052) and [The Key of Solomon](/card/10104) cancel one another's tokens. * Then: * Add a if you play any other card that adds to the bag ([Prismatic Spectacles](/card/10056), [Promise of Power](/card/07032), [Deep Knowledge](/card/07023), [Faustian Bargain](/card/07028)). * Add a to prevent if you want to play [Spectral Razor (2)](/card/10102) or [Read the Signs (2)](/card/10101). * Otherwise, add a . * Please use the Bless/Curse token counter provided by FFG in this box. It was designed explicitly for [Kōhaku](/card/10012) players and will make your experience playing him much more enjoyable. ___ ** During an investigation turn: ** _
Initial Bag Status: 0 / 0
_ 1. Use [Kōhaku](/card/10012)'s ability to add one to the bag. 2. Use [Gabriel Carillo](/card/10052) to add one to the bag and draw one card. 3. Use your [Prismatic Spectacles](/card/10056) to investigate, add 1 to the bag. 3.1. Use [The Key of Solomon](/card/10104) during the first window to pull a from the bag and gain 2 resources. 3.2. Commit 2 copies of [Fey](/card/07222). 3.4. Test at 11 . 3.5 Use the [Book of Living Myths](/card/10013) to pull a , and reveal another token. 3.6 Discover 2 clues. 4. Play [Read the Signs (2)](/card/10101). 4.1. Commit 2 copies of [Fey](/card/07222). 4.3. Test at 13 . 4.2. Use [Favor of the Moon](/card/07271) to resolve a token, and reveal another token. 4.3. Discover 2 clues. 5. Move away from this empty location. 6. Get [Read the Signs (2)](/card/10101) back in your hand. 7. Upkeep. Results: +4 clues, 1 move, +2 cards, +1 resource, all played cards back in hand and 1 [Favor of the Moon](/card/07271) use consumed. _
Final Bag Status: 1 / 0
_ ___ ** During a combat turn: ** _
Initial Bag Status: 0 / 0
_ 1. Use [Kōhaku](/card/10012)'s ability to add one to the bag. 2. Use [Gabriel Carillo](/card/10052) and add one to the bag. 3. Use your [Armageddon](/card/07117) to fight. 3.1. Use [The Key of Solomon](/card/10104) during the first window to pull a from the bag and gain 2 resources. 3.2. Commit 2 copies of [Fey](/card/07222). 3.3. Test at 10 . 3.4. Use the [Book of Living Myths](/card/10013) to pull a , and reveal another token. 3.5. Deal 1 damage to the [Servant of Brass](/card/10107) to deal 2 damage to the enemy or any other enemy at a connecting location. 3.6 Deal 2 or 3 damage. 4. Use another charge of [Armageddon](/card/07117) or play [Spectral Razor (2)](/card/10102). 4.1. Commit 2 copies of [Fey](/card/07222). 4.2. Test at 11 or 9 . 4.3. Use [Favor of the Moon](/card/07271) to resolve a token. 4.4. Deal 1 damage to the [Servant of Brass](/card/10107) to deal 2 damage to the enemy. 4.5 Deal 2 to 3 damage. 5. Repeat, move or investigate. 6. Get [Spectral Razor (2)](/card/10102) back in your hand. 7. Upkeep. Results: 8 to 10 damage, one move, +2 cards, +1 resource, all cards back in hand, one [Favor of the Moon](/card/07271) use consumed, and up to 2 damage dealt to the [Servant of Brass](/card/10107). _
Final Bag Status: 0 / 0
_ ___ ** Important Notes: ** * In practice, in 99,9% of the cases, adding the curse with [Gabriel Carillo](/card/10052) is immediately followed by the option to remove it with [The Key of Solomon](/card/10104). So, you can save some hassle by just skipping the token part and exhaust [The Key of Solomon](/card/10104) to draw 1 card and 2 resources without interfering with the bag. * There are 2 important other player windows that are good to know for using [The Key of Solomon](/card/10104). * The first one is just after any player draws 1 encounter card. This means that you can use it during the Mythos Phase before any test happens to remove a that is left from the previous turn and make sure it is not pulled during a test on a treachery card. * The second one is when an investigator's turn begins, so before even [Kōhaku](/card/10012) and [Gabriel](/card/10052)'s . This can help you manipulate the bag so you start your turn with the optimal situation for your plans. * As you set up your board, you will, for instance, not necessarily use [Gabriel Carillo](/card/10052)'s if you didn't find [The Key of Solomon](/card/10104) yet, so you do not overload the bag with you can't absorb. * The Mulligan priorities to accelerate your set-up are: * [Backpack (2)](/card/53011) (If you don't have it, do yourself a favour and proxy it with the level 0) * [Book of Living Myths](/card/10013) so you can use tokens immediately with your [Ancient Covenant](/card/07122) and start succeeding tests. * [The Key of Solomon](/card/10104) or [Faustian Bargain](/card/07028) to pay for your setup * [Deep Knowledge](/card/07023) to get more cards. * [Spectral Razor](/card/06201) in case you pull an early enemy or [Armageddon](/card/07117) if you also have the [Book of Living Myths](/card/10013). * Anything else goes back into your deck. * Once set up, this deck is extraordinary by its consistency, dealing levels of damage main fighters often struggle to deliver while also picking up clues at a tempo expected to main cluevers. But because it is all very combo-y, it can take a little while to assemble all the puzzle pieces, and one missing can make the scenario really challenging. That's why the deck has a lot of draw and tutors. ___
**
Other Cards:
** [![FHV.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/MHFt290h/FHV.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/LgjjjBbT) * [In the Thick of It](/card/08125) is a good way to start with [Ancient Covenant](/card/07122), without which the deck really struggles. We choose 2 mental trauma. * [Backpack (2)](/card/53011) is the unsung hero of many decks. It speeds up your set-up tremendously. * A typical first turn is to add 1 with [Kōhaku](/card/10012)'s ability, then play the [Backpack (2)](/card/53011), and immediately from it [The Key of Solomon](/card/10104) and [Book of Living Myths](/card/10013), for 5 resources, and you get 2 resources back right after, during the other investigator's turn or the beginning of the enemy phase. * While only hitting 1 target with the [Backpack (2)](/card/53011) may _feel_ bad, the key combo pieces of this deck are so vital that it is still a good outcome. And if it whiffs, tell yourself that it means that you would have spent the equivalent of 12 turns (almost an entire scenario) without seeing your combo piece, so just by shuffling your deck, [Backpack (2)](/card/53011) is helping you already! * [Faustian Bargain](/card/07028) is here because [The Key of Solomon](/card/10104) sometimes hides, and it makes the board really hard to set up. * On top of that, it can help teammates and/or add 2 before you play a [Favor of the Moon](/card/07271). Finally, it can even be committed to [Armageddon](/card/07117), [Read the Signs](/card/06117) or [Prismatic Spectacles](/card/10056). * [Guts](/card/01089) and [Perception](/card/01090) are mostly here to support tests before you find [Fey](/card/07222), and as cantrips to speed up the pace at which you hit your combo cards. * [Prescient](/card/60419) is great in this deck because you secure some Symbol tokens each turn, so you can effectively use it to recur [Read the Signs](/card/06117) and [Spectral Razor](/card/06201) whenever you attack with [Armageddon](/card/07117). * [Promise of Power](/card/07032) helps with skills you are afraid to fail, like scenario tests or an early important test before you found [Fey](/card/07222). ** Level 0 Deck: ** The early deck relies much more on the [Ancient Covenant](/card/07122) to secure one test per turn. * [Crystal Pendulum](/card/60411) is a great addition since you know in advance, once per turn, how much you will succeed by. * [Scroll of Secrets](/card/05116) is great to have some filtered draw. Even if it competes for the hand slot, their contribution to set up is very appreciated. * [Arcane Initiate](/card/01063) is fantastic in this deck, and upgrading to [Gabriel Carillo](/card/10052) is almost only for the Lore. Finding your spells is extremely important, and she does it arguably better than the geometry teacher. * [Explosive Ward](/card/09087) is a great way to have 2 testless damage in case you didn't find [Armageddon](/card/07117) yet. And even after, it is a solid 1-ping for early enemies. * Because it is testless, it is also a great answer to [Weeping Yurei](/card/10014). * The icons are also great to commit to a [Spectral Razor](/card/06201) test. * Speaking of testless damage, another option is [Occult Lexicon](/card/05316), which has great flexibility: * Draw, which can be found by the [Arcane Initiate](/card/01063) since [Blood-Rite](/card/05317) is a _Spell_. * Resources in case you don't find [Faustian Bargain](/card/07028). * Testless damage, again, interesting against the [Weeping Yurei](/card/10014). * [Diabolical Luck](/card/10075) is a great way to deal with early , before you get [Fey](/card/07222). The fact that it is reactive makes this card a 0 cost [Lucky!](/card/01080) for . **Luxury Upgrades:** After you reach the displayed version of the deck, the only valuable upgrades I could come up with are: * [Occult Reliquary](/card/10132) + [Eye of the Djinn](/card/07225) * Since we pull a every turn, the [Eye of the Djinn](/card/07225) is a great way to have a 4th action every turn with no downside. * After adding the [Eye of the Djinn](/card/07225), we have 4 colours, so we can use [Close the Circle](/card/08062) for 3 bonus actions or [Call for Backup](/card/08129), which is one of the only cards that can heal [Servant of Brass](/card/10107). **Cards that didn't make the cut:** * [Tempt Fate](/card/07037) is probably one of the most surprising cards that is not in this deck. It _is_ good in [Kōhaku Narukami](/card/10012), but it does what I didn't want this deck to do: add more blurse in the bag than what I can reliably use and, therefore, increase the variance of tests for my whole team. * [Control Variable](/card/10046) has been part of my testing, but it didn't give me enough value. The reason was mainly that this deck picks up clues 2 by 2, and clues are often X , which results in even numbers unless you play true solo. In this case, its worth increases significantly. * [Blasphemous Covenant](/card/07113) is the one I tried the most, but the problem is that it leaves the in the bag. It can be helpful when you want to use the same Token for both [Book of Living Myths](/card/10013) and [The Key of Solomon](/card/10104), but in practice, it mostly prevents us from clearing the bag. * [Guided by Faith](/card/10025) is good, especially since we have the [Ancient Covenant](/card/07122), but adding 2 in the bag can mess up our ability to control the bag by choosing at all time what token to add with [Kōhaku](/card/10012)'s ability. The same reason explains why [Purified](/card/10029) is not in the deck. * [Mesmeric Influence](/card/10096), [Mind Wipe](/card/01068) and to a lesser extent [Manipulate Destiny](/card/07162) are great options to fight [Weeping Yurei](/card/10014), but in practice, we either use [Spectral Razor](/card/06201) (which is great since it's Aloof) or we throw one [Armageddon](/card/07117) charge and accept to take 2 horror. [The Key of Solomon](/card/10104) can easily heal it anyway. * [Wicked Athame](/card/10092) is good, but doesn't fit this deck. First of all, we almost never need additional charges on [Armageddon](/card/07117), [Armageddon](/card/07117) can already deal with 2,3 and 4hp enemies quite well, and finally, our hands are already full with greater value. * [Beloved](/card/07036) didn't make the cut because, with the [Ancient Covenant](/card/07122), plays the same role, but is permanent and repeatable. It's not bad, but it's not good enough to justify a deck space. ___

Make Your Own Deck!
** [![ahc76-77-splash-art-2-700.png](https://i.postimg.cc/qMxTZZkC/ahc76-77-splash-art-2-700.png)](https://postimg.cc/PPJ9Cyvt) > For the following section, "Revised collection" means you have all the Investigator Expansions released in the Revised format at this deck's publishing date.
